blocks.text: From considerations of symmetry we see that the centroid of the section must lie on the line \( G_{zg} \) at G.
Treat \( G_{z} \) of length \( 16 \) in., \( z_{x} = 2 \) as a bar loaded with \( 64 \) lbs.
Let \( G_{G} = x \); then the upward force at G = \( \frac{64}{3} \) lbs.

blocks.description: Moment calculation gives the relationship of forces and distances.

blocks.text: Hence the distance of the centroid from the outside of the flange is \( \frac{64}{62} + 72'' = L0'2 \).
